reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 664/21: FEES FOR CENTRAL BARGAINING

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “legislative grant regulation” means a regulation made under subsection 234 (1) of the Education Act.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“legislative grant regulation” means a regulation made under subsection 234 (1) of the Education Act.

content.content: 2. (1) Every school authority shall pay a fee of $1,000 to the Ontario Public School Boards’ Association for each school board fiscal year. (2) A school authority shall pay the fee on or before October 15, 2021 for the 2021-2022 school board fiscal year, and on or before December 30 every subsequent year. (3) Despite subsection (1), the Ottawa Children’s Treatment Centre School Authority is not required to pay fees.
content.raw_html:
2. (1) Every school authority shall pay a fee of $1,000 to the Ontario Public School Boards’ Association for each school board fiscal year.

(2) A school authority shall pay the fee on or before October 15, 2021 for the 2021-2022 school board fiscal year, and on or before December 30 every subsequent year.

(3) Despite subsection (1), the Ottawa Children’s Treatment Centre School Authority is not required to pay fees.

content.content: 3. (1) For each school board fiscal year, every district school board shall pay the amount set out in the legislative grant regulation for the year for the employer bargaining agency fee to the applicable trustees’ association, as follows: 1.  An English-language public district school board shall pay the fee to the Ontario Public School Boards’ Association. 2.  An English-language separate district school board shall pay the fee to the Ontario Catholic School Trustees’ Association. 3.  A French-language public district school board shall pay the fee to l’Association des conseils scolaires des écoles publiques de l’Ontario. 4.  A French-language separate district school board shall pay the fee to l’Association franco-ontarienne des conseils scolaires catholiques. (2) A district school board shall pay the fee no later than 45 days after it receives the trustees’ association’s financial statements for the previous school board fiscal year under section 5. (3) Despite subsection (2), a district school board shall pay the fee on or before October 15, 2021 for the 2021-2022 school board fiscal year.
content.raw_html:
3. (1) For each school board fiscal year, every district school board shall pay the amount set out in the legislative grant regulation for the year for the employer bargaining agency fee to the applicable trustees’ association, as follows:

1.  An English-language public district school board shall pay the fee to the Ontario Public School Boards’ Association.

2.  An English-language separate district school board shall pay the fee to the Ontario Catholic School Trustees’ Association.

3.  A French-language public district school board shall pay the fee to l’Association des conseils scolaires des écoles publiques de l’Ontario.

4.  A French-language separate district school board shall pay the fee to l’Association franco-ontarienne des conseils scolaires catholiques.

(2) A district school board shall pay the fee no later than 45 days after it receives the trustees’ association’s financial statements for the previous school board fiscal year under section 5.

(3) Despite subsection (2), a district school board shall pay the fee on or before October 15, 2021 for the 2021-2022 school board fiscal year.

content.content: 4. (1) If a school authority or district school board does not pay the required fee by the day specified in section 2 or 3, as the case may be, the affected trustees’ association shall notify every board it represents of this fact. (2) If a school authority or district school board does not pay the required fee within 30 days after the day specified in section 2 or 3, as the case may be, the affected trustees’ association shall notify every board it represents, and the Crown, of this fact, and the school authority or district school board forfeits its entitlement to participate in a vote described in subsection 21 (4) of the Act starting on the day the notice is given. (3) If a school authority or district school board pays all fees in respect of which its entitlement to vote was forfeited under this Regulation, and under predecessors and successors of this section in regulations made under subsection 21 (10) of the Act, the trustees’ association shall notify every board it represents, and the Crown, of this fact within 14 days after receiving the payment, and the entitlement to vote is reinstated on the earlier of, (a)  the day the trustees’ association gives the notice; and (b)  14 days after the trustees’ association receives payment of the fees in full.
content.raw_html:
4. (1) If a school authority or district school board does not pay the required fee by the day specified in section 2 or 3, as the case may be, the affected trustees’ association shall notify every board it represents of this fact.

(2) If a school authority or district school board does not pay the required fee within 30 days after the day specified in section 2 or 3, as the case may be, the affected trustees’ association shall notify every board it represents, and the Crown, of this fact, and the school authority or district school board forfeits its entitlement to participate in a vote described in subsection 21 (4) of the Act starting on the day the notice is given.

(3) If a school authority or district school board pays all fees in respect of which its entitlement to vote was forfeited under this Regulation, and under predecessors and successors of this section in regulations made under subsection 21 (10) of the Act, the trustees’ association shall notify every board it represents, and the Crown, of this fact within 14 days after receiving the payment, and the entitlement to vote is reinstated on the earlier of,

(a)  the day the trustees’ association gives the notice; and

(b)  14 days after the trustees’ association receives payment of the fees in full.

content.content: 5. (1) Every trustees’ association shall provide the applicable district school board and the Ministry with an audited financial statement in respect of each school board fiscal year. (2) The audited financial statement for a school board fiscal year must be provided no later than November 15 in the subsequent school board fiscal year. (3) Subsection (2) does not apply in respect of financial statements for the 2020-2021 school board fiscal year.
content.raw_html:
5. (1) Every trustees’ association shall provide the applicable district school board and the Ministry with an audited financial statement in respect of each school board fiscal year.

(2) The audited financial statement for a school board fiscal year must be provided no later than November 15 in the subsequent school board fiscal year.

(3) Subsection (2) does not apply in respect of financial statements for the 2020-2021 school board fiscal year.

content.content: 6. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).
